90-Day Chinese Summer Program 🇨🇳

Week 10 - Technology & Internet

💻 Week 10: Technology & Internet

day 64

  1. 科技 (kējì)
    • pinyin: kējì
    • definition: science and technology
    • usage: the application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry. (repeated for emphasis in this theme)
    • example: 科技的进步改变了我们的生活方式。(kējì de jìnbù gǎibiàn le wǒmen de shēnghuó fāngshì.) - the advancement of technology has changed our lifestyle.
    • contexts: innovation, modern life, industry, research.
  2. 互联网 (hùliánwǎng)
    • pinyin: hùliánwǎng
    • definition: internet
    • usage: a global computer network providing a variety of information and communication facilities, consisting of interconnected networks using standardized communication protocols.
    • example: 互联网已经成为信息传播的主要渠道。(hùliánwǎng yǐjīng chéngwéi xìnxī chuánbō de zhǔyào qúdào.) - the internet has become the main channel for information dissemination.
    • contexts: communication, information, technology, daily life.
  3. 网络 (wǎngluò)
    • pinyin: wǎngluò
    • definition: network (computer, social, etc.); internet
    • usage: a group or system of interconnected people or things. often used interchangeably with 互联网 for internet.
    • example: 我们公司的内部网络很安全。(wǒmen gōngsī de nèibù wǎngluò hěn ānquán.) - our company’s internal network is very secure.
    • contexts: technology, communication, computers, social connections.
  4. 网站 (wǎngzhàn)
    • pinyin: wǎngzhàn
    • definition: website
    • usage: a location connected to the internet that maintains one or more pages on the world wide web.
    • example: 我经常浏览这个新闻网站。(wǒ jīngcháng liúlǎn zhège xīnwén wǎngzhàn.) - i often browse this news website.
    • contexts: internet, information, e-commerce, entertainment.
  5. 浏览器 (liúlǎnqì)
    • pinyin: liúlǎnqì
    • definition: browser (software)
    • usage: a software application for accessing information on the world wide web.
    • example: 你通常使用哪个浏览器？(nǐ tōngcháng shǐyòng nǎge liúlǎnqì?) - which browser do you usually use?
    • contexts: internet, software, computers, web surfing.
  6. 搜索引擎 (sōusuǒ yǐnqíng)
    • pinyin: sōusuǒ yǐnqíng
    • definition: search engine
    • usage: a program that searches for and identifies items in a database that correspond to keywords or characters specified by the user, used especially for finding particular sites on the world wide web.
    • example: 谷歌是一个非常流行的搜索引擎。(gǔgē shì yī gè fēicháng liúxíng de sōusuǒ yǐnqíng.) - google is a very popular search engine.
    • contexts: internet, information retrieval, research.
  7. 电子邮件 (diànzǐ yóujiàn)
    • pinyin: diànzǐ yóujiàn
    • definition: email
    • usage: messages distributed by electronic means from one computer user to one or more recipients via a network.
    • example: 请把文件通过电子邮件发给我。(qǐng bǎ wénjiàn tōngguò diànzǐ yóujiàn fā gěi wǒ.) - please send the file to me via email.
    • contexts: communication, business, internet.
  8. 下载 (xiàzài)
    • pinyin: xiàzài
    • definition: to download
    • usage: copy (data) from one computer system to another, typically over the internet.
    • example: 我需要下载这个软件的最新版本。(wǒ xūyào xiàzài zhège ruǎnjiàn de zuìxīn bǎnběn.) - i need to download the latest version of this software.
    • contexts: internet, software, files, multimedia.
  9. 上传 (shàngchuán)
    • pinyin: shàngchuán
    • definition: to upload
    • usage: transfer (data) from one computer to another, typically to one that is larger or remote from the user or functioning as a server.
    • example: 他把照片上传到了社交媒体。(tā bǎ zhàopiàn shàngchuán dàole shèjiāo méitǐ.) - he uploaded the photos to social media.
    • contexts: internet, files, social media, cloud storage.
  10. 用户名 (yònghùmíng)
    • pinyin: yònghùmíng
    • definition: username
    • usage: an identification used by a person with access to a computer, network, or online service.
    • example: 我忘了我的用户名是什么了。(wǒ wàng le wǒ de yònghùmíng shì shénme le.) - i forgot what my username is.
    • contexts: internet accounts, login, software.

day 65

  1. 密码 (mìmǎ)
    • pinyin: mìmǎ
    • definition: password
    • usage: a secret word or phrase that must be used to gain admission to something.
    • example: 请设置一个复杂的密码以保护您的账户安全。(qǐng shèzhì yī gè fùzá de mìmǎ yǐ bǎohù nín de zhànghù ānquán.) - please set a complex password to protect your account security.
    • contexts: internet accounts, login, security, privacy.
  2. 账户 (zhànghù)
    • pinyin: zhànghù
    • definition: account (e.g., bank, online service)
    • usage: a record or statement of financial expenditure and receipts relating to a particular period or purpose; an arrangement by which a user is given personalized access to a computer, website, or application.
    • example: 我需要登录我的银行账户。(wǒ xūyào dēnglù wǒ de yínháng zhànghù.) - i need to log in to my bank account.
    • contexts: finance, internet services, login.
  3. 登录 (dēnglù)
    • pinyin: dēnglù
    • definition: to log in; to sign in
    • usage: to go through the procedures to begin use of a computer system or online service.
    • example: 请输入用户名和密码登录。(qǐng shūrù yònghùmíng hé mìmǎ dēnglù.) - please enter your username and password to log in.
    • contexts: internet accounts, software, computers.
  4. 注册 (zhùcè)
    • pinyin: zhùcè
    • definition: to register; to sign up
    • usage: to enter or record on an official list or directory.
    • example: 你需要先注册一个账户才能使用这项服务。(nǐ xūyào xiān zhùcè yī gè zhànghù cáinéng shǐyòng zhè xiàng fúwù.) - you need to register an account first to use this service.
    • contexts: internet services, websites, applications, membership.
  5. 软件 (ruǎnjiàn)
    • pinyin: ruǎnjiàn
    • definition: software
    • usage: the programs and other operating information used by a computer.
    • example: 我安装了一些新的办公软件。(wǒ ānzhuāng le yīxiē xīn de bàngōng ruǎnjiàn.) - i installed some new office software.
    • contexts: computers, technology, applications.
  6. 硬件 (yìngjiàn)
    • pinyin: yìngjiàn
    • definition: hardware (computer)
    • usage: the machines, wiring, and other physical components of a computer or other electronic system.
    • example: 这台电脑的硬件配置很高。(zhè tái diànnǎo de yìngjiàn pèizhì hěn gāo.) - the hardware configuration of this computer is very high.
    • contexts: computers, technology, electronics.
  7. 操作系统 (cāozuò xìtǒng)
    • pinyin: cāozuò xìtǒng
    • definition: operating system (OS)
    • usage: the software that supports a computer’s basic functions, such as scheduling tasks, executing applications, and controlling peripherals.
    • example: Windows 和 macOS 是常见的操作系统。(windows hé macos shì chángjiàn de cāozuò xìtǒng.) - windows and macos are common operating systems.
    • contexts: computers, software, technology.
  8. 应用程序 (yìngyòng chéngxù)
    • pinyin: yìngyòng chéngxù
    • definition: application program; app
    • usage: a program or piece of software designed and written to fulfill a particular purpose of the user.
    • example: 我手机上安装了很多有用的应用程序。(wǒ shǒujī shàng ānzhuāng le hěnduō yǒuyòng de yìngyòng chéngxù.) - i have installed many useful apps on my phone.
    • contexts: software, mobile devices, computers, technology.
  9. 病毒 (bìngdú)
    • pinyin: bìngdú
    • definition: virus (computer or biological)
    • usage: a piece of code which is capable of copying itself and typically has a detrimental effect, such as corrupting the system or destroying data; a microorganism that causes disease.
    • example: 我的电脑中病毒了，需要杀毒。(wǒ de diànnǎo zhòng bìngdú le, xūyào shādú.) - my computer has a virus, i need to run an antivirus scan.
    • contexts: computer security, health, cybersecurity.
  10. 防火墙 (fánghuǒqiáng)
    • pinyin: fánghuǒqiáng
    • definition: firewall (computing)
    • usage: a part of a computer system or network that is designed to block unauthorized access while permitting outward communication.
    • example: 安装防火墙可以提高网络安全。(ānzhuāng fánghuǒqiáng kěyǐ tígāo wǎngluò ānquán.) - installing a firewall can improve network security.
    • contexts: computer security, network, internet, cybersecurity.

day 66

  1. 数据库 (shùjùkù)
    • pinyin: shùjùkù
    • definition: database
    • usage: a structured set of data held in a computer, especially one that is accessible in various ways.
    • example: 这个公司拥有庞大的客户数据库。(zhège gōngsī yōngyǒu pángdà de kèhù shùjùkù.) - this company has a large customer database.
    • contexts: computing, information technology, business, data management.
  2. 服务器 (fúwùqì)
    • pinyin: fúwùqì
    • definition: server (computing)
    • usage: a computer or computer program which manages access to a centralized resource or service in a network.
    • example: 网站的数据存储在远程服务器上。(wǎngzhàn de shùjù cúnchǔ zài yuǎnchéng fúwùqì shàng.) - the website’s data is stored on a remote server.
    • contexts: computing, internet, networking, IT infrastructure.
  3. 云计算 (yún jìsuàn)
    • pinyin: yún jìsuàn
    • definition: cloud computing
    • usage: the practice of using a network of remote servers hosted on the internet to store, manage, and process data, rather than a local server or a personal computer.
    • example: 云计算为企业提供了更灵活的数据存储方案。(yún jìsuàn wèi qǐyè tígōng le gèng línghuó de shùjù cúnchǔ fāng’àn.) - cloud computing provides businesses with more flexible data storage solutions.
    • contexts: technology, internet, data storage, IT services.
  4. 大数据 (dà shùjù)
    • pinyin: dà shùjù
    • definition: big data
    • usage: extremely large data sets that may be analyzed computationally to reveal patterns, trends, and associations, especially relating to human behavior and interactions.
    • example: 大数据分析在商业决策中越来越重要。(dà shùjù fēnxī zài shāngyè juécè zhōng yuèláiyuè zhòngyào.) - big data analysis is becoming increasingly important in business decision-making.
    • contexts: technology, data analysis, business intelligence, research.
  5. 人工智能 (réngōng zhìnéng)
    • pinyin: réngōng zhìnéng
    • definition: artificial intelligence (AI)
    • usage: the theory and development of computer systems able to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and translation between languages.
    • example: 人工智能正在改变各个行业。(réngōng zhìnéng zhèngzài gǎibiàn gège hángyè.) - artificial intelligence is transforming various industries.
    • contexts: technology, computer science, robotics, future trends.
  6. 机器学习 (jīqì xuéxí)
    • pinyin: jīqì xuéxí
    • definition: machine learning
    • usage: an application of artificial intelligence (AI) that provides systems the ability to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed.
    • example: 机器学习是人工智能的一个重要分支。(jīqì xuéxí shì réngōng zhìnéng de yī gè zhòngyào fēnzhī.) - machine learning is an important branch of artificial intelligence.
    • contexts: artificial intelligence, data science, computer science, technology.
  7. 虚拟现实 (xūnǐ xiànshí)
    • pinyin: xūnǐ xiànshí
    • definition: virtual reality (VR)
    • usage: the computer-generated simulation of a three-dimensional image or environment that can be interacted with in a seemingly real or physical way by a person using special electronic equipment, such as a helmet with a screen inside or gloves fitted with sensors.
    • example: 虚拟现实技术广泛应用于游戏和培训领域。(xūnǐ xiànshí jìshù guǎngfàn yìngyòng yú yóuxì hé péixùn lǐngyù.) - virtual reality technology is widely used in gaming and training fields.
    • contexts: technology, gaming, simulation, entertainment, education.
  8. 增强现实 (zēngqiáng xiànshí)
    • pinyin: zēngqiáng xiànshí
    • definition: augmented reality (AR)
    • usage: a technology that superimposes a computer-generated image on a user’s view of the real world, thus providing a composite view.
    • example: 一些手机应用使用增强现实技术来提供互动体验。(yīxiē shǒujī yìngyòng shǐyòng zēngqiáng xiànshí jìshù lái tígōng hùdòng tǐyàn.) - some mobile apps use augmented reality technology to provide interactive experiences.
    • contexts: technology, mobile apps, gaming, marketing.
  9. 区块链 (qūkuàiliàn)
    • pinyin: qūkuàiliàn
    • definition: blockchain
    • usage: a system in which a record of transactions made in bitcoin or another cryptocurrency are maintained across several computers that are linked in a peer-to-peer network.
    • example: 区块链技术被认为是具有革命性的。(qūkuàiliàn jìshù bèi rènwéi shì jùyǒu gémìngxìng de.) - blockchain technology is considered revolutionary.
    • contexts: cryptocurrency, finance, technology, data security.
  10. 加密货币 (jiāmì huòbì)
    • pinyin: jiāmì huòbì
    • definition: cryptocurrency
    • usage: a digital currency in which transactions are verified and records maintained by a decentralized system using cryptography, rather than by a centralized authority.
    • example: 比特币是最早的加密货币之一。(bǐtèbì shì zuìzǎo de jiāmì huòbì zhīyī.) - bitcoin is one of the earliest cryptocurrencies.
    • contexts: finance, technology, blockchain, investment.

day 67

  1. 智能手机 (zhìnéng shǒujī)
    • pinyin: zhìnéng shǒujī
    • definition: smartphone
    • usage: a mobile phone that performs many of the functions of a computer, typically having a touchscreen interface, internet access, and an operating system capable of running downloaded applications.
    • example: 现在几乎人手一部智能手机。(xiànzài jīhū rénshǒu yī bù zhìnéng shǒujī.) - nowadays, almost everyone has a smartphone.
    • contexts: technology, communication, mobile devices, daily life.
  2. 平板电脑 (píngbǎn diànnǎo)
    • pinyin: píngbǎn diànnǎo
    • definition: tablet computer; tablet
    • usage: a portable personal computer with a touchscreen interface, typically smaller than a laptop but larger than a smartphone.
    • example: 我喜欢用平板电脑看电影。(wǒ xǐhuān yòng píngbǎn diànnǎo kàn diànyǐng.) - i like to watch movies on my tablet.
    • contexts: technology, mobile devices, entertainment, work.
  3. 笔记本电脑 (bǐjìběn diànnǎo)
    • pinyin: bǐjìběn diànnǎo
    • definition: laptop computer; notebook computer
    • usage: a portable computer small enough to use on one’s lap.
    • example: 我需要买一台新的笔记本电脑来工作。(wǒ xūyào mǎi yī tái xīn de bǐjìběn diànnǎo lái gōngzuò.) - i need to buy a new laptop for work.
    • contexts: technology, computers, work, education.
  4. 数码相机 (shùmǎ xiàngjī)
    • pinyin: shùmǎ xiàngjī
    • definition: digital camera
    • usage: a camera that records and stores digital images.
    • example: 虽然手机拍照很方便，但我还是喜欢用数码相机。(suīrán shǒujī pāizhào hěn fāngbiàn, dàn wǒ háishì xǐhuān yòng shùmǎ xiàngjī.) - although taking photos with a phone is convenient, i still prefer using a digital camera.
    • contexts: photography, technology, electronics, hobbies.
  5. 可穿戴设备 (kě chuāndài shèbèi)
    • pinyin: kě chuāndài shèbèi
    • definition: wearable device (e.g., smartwatch, fitness tracker)
    • usage: electronic devices that are worn by a user, typically incorporating sensors and wireless communication capabilities.
    • example: 智能手表是最常见的可穿戴设备之一。(zhìnéng shǒubiǎo shì zuì chángjiàn de kě chuāndài shèbèi zhīyī.) - smartwatches are one of the most common wearable devices.
    • contexts: technology, fitness, health, electronics.
  6. 智能家居 (zhìnéng jiājū)
    • pinyin: zhìnéng jiājū
    • definition: smart home
    • usage: home automation systems that control lighting, climate, entertainment systems, and appliances.
    • example: 智能家居让生活更便捷。(zhìnéng jiājū ràng shēnghuó gèng biànjié.) - smart homes make life more convenient.
    • contexts: technology, home automation, lifestyle, internet of things.
  7. 物联网 (wùliánwǎng)
    • pinyin: wùliánwǎng
    • definition: internet of things (IoT)
    • usage: the interconnection via the internet of computing devices embedded in everyday objects, enabling them to send and receive data.
    • example: 物联网技术正在快速发展。(wùliánwǎng jìshù zhèngzài kuàisù fāzhǎn.) - internet of things technology is developing rapidly.
    • contexts: technology, smart devices, connectivity, future trends.
  8. 无线网络 (wúxiàn wǎngluò)
    • pinyin: wúxiàn wǎngluò
    • definition: wireless network; Wi-Fi
    • usage: a computer network that uses wireless data connections between network nodes.
    • example: 咖啡馆提供免费无线网络。(kāfēiguǎn tígōng miǎnfèi wúxiàn wǎngluò.) - the cafe offers free wi-fi.
    • contexts: internet, connectivity, technology, public spaces.
  9. 蓝牙 (lányá)
    • pinyin: lányá
    • definition: bluetooth
    • usage: a standard for the short-range wireless interconnection of mobile phones, computers, and other electronic devices.
    • example: 我用蓝牙耳机听音乐。(wǒ yòng lányá ěrjī tīng yīnyuè.) - i use bluetooth headphones to listen to music.
    • contexts: technology, wireless communication, electronic devices.
  10. 二维码 (èrwéimǎ)
    • pinyin: èrwéimǎ
    • definition: QR code (quick response code)
    • usage: a machine-readable code consisting of an array of black and white squares, typically used for storing URLs or other information for reading by the camera on a smartphone.
    • example: 请扫描这个二维码付款。(qǐng sǎomiáo zhège èrwéimǎ fùkuǎn.) - please scan this qr code to make a payment.
    • contexts: mobile payment, information sharing, marketing, technology.

day 68

  1. 程序员 (chéngxùyuán)
    • pinyin: chéngxùyuán
    • definition: programmer
    • usage: a person who writes computer programs.
    • example: 他立志成为一名优秀的程序员。(tā lìzhì chéngwéi yī míng yōuxiù de chéngxùyuán.) - he aspires to become an excellent programmer.
    • contexts: technology, software development, IT industry, professions.
  2. 工程师 (gōngchéngshī)
    • pinyin: gōngchéngshī
    • definition: engineer
    • usage: a person who designs, builds, or maintains engines, machines, or public works.
    • example: 这座桥梁是由一位著名工程师设计的。(zhè zuò qiáoliáng shì yóu yī wèi zhùmíng gōngchéngshī shèjì de.) - this bridge was designed by a famous engineer.
    • contexts: technology, construction, manufacturing, professions.
  3. 开发者 (kāifāzhě)
    • pinyin: kāifāzhě
    • definition: developer (e.g., software developer)
    • usage: a person or company that creates new products, especially software or computer applications.
    • example: 这款应用是由一个小型开发者团队制作的。(zhè kuǎn yìngyòng shì yóu yī gè xiǎoxíng kāifāzhě tuánduì zhìzuò de.) - this app was created by a small team of developers.
    • contexts: software, technology, IT industry, game development.
  4. 用户体验 (yònghù tǐyàn)
    • pinyin: yònghù tǐyàn
    • definition: user experience (UX)
    • usage: the overall experience of a person using a product such as a website or computer application, especially in terms of how easy or pleasing it is to use.
    • example: 好的用户体验对产品成功至关重要。(hǎo de yònghù tǐyàn duì chǎnpǐn chénggōng zhìguān zhòngyào.) - good user experience is crucial for product success.
    • contexts: product design, web design, software development, marketing.
  5. 用户界面 (yònghù jièmiàn)
    • pinyin: yònghù jièmiàn
    • definition: user interface (UI)
    • usage: the means by which the user and a computer system interact, in particular the use of input devices and software.
    • example: 这个软件的用户界面设计得很简洁。(zhège ruǎnjiàn de yònghù jièmiàn shèjì de hěn jiǎnjié.) - the user interface of this software is designed very concisely.
    • contexts: software design, web design, app development, human-computer interaction.
  6. 算法 (suànfǎ)
    • pinyin: suànfǎ
    • definition: algorithm
    • usage: a process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or other problem-solving operations, especially by a computer.
    • example: 搜索引擎使用复杂的算法对网页进行排序。(sōusuǒ yǐnqíng shǐyòng fùzá de suànfǎ duì wǎngyè jìnxíng páixù.) - search engines use complex algorithms to rank web pages.
    • contexts: computer science, mathematics, data analysis, AI.
  7. 代码 (dàimǎ)
    • pinyin: dàimǎ
    • definition: code (computer programming)
    • usage: program instructions.
    • example: 程序员正在编写新的代码。(chéngxùyuán zhèngzài biānxiě xīn de dàimǎ.) - the programmer is writing new code.
    • contexts: software development, programming, computer science.
  8. 开源 (kāiyuán)
    • pinyin: kāiyuán
    • definition: open source
    • usage: denoting software for which the original source code is made freely available and may be redistributed and modified.
    • example: Linux 是一个著名的开源操作系统。(linux shì yī gè zhùmíng de kāiyuán cāozuò xìtǒng.) - linux is a famous open-source operating system.
    • contexts: software development, technology, collaboration, programming.
  9. 测试 (cèshì)
    • pinyin: cèshì
    • definition: to test; test; beta version (of software)
    • usage: take measures to check the quality, performance, or reliability of (something), especially before putting it into widespread use or practice.
    • example: 软件发布前需要进行严格的测试。(ruǎnjiàn fābù qián xūyào jìnxíng yángé de cèshì.) - software needs to undergo rigorous testing before release.
    • contexts: software development, quality assurance, product development.
  10. 更新 (gēngxīn)
    • pinyin: gēngxīn
    • definition: to update; to renew; update (noun)
    • usage: make (something) more modern or up to date.
    • example: 请及时更新您的软件版本。(qǐng jíshí gēngxīn nín de ruǎnjiàn bǎnběn.) - please update your software version in a timely manner.
    • contexts: software, technology, information, news.

day 69

  1. 数字化 (shùzìhuà)
    • pinyin: shùzìhuà
    • definition: digitization; to digitize
    • usage: the conversion of text, pictures, or sound into a digital form that can be processed by a computer.
    • example: 传统行业正在经历数字化转型。(chuántǒng hángyè zhèngzài jīnglì shùzìhuà zhuǎnxíng.) - traditional industries are undergoing digital transformation.
    • contexts: technology, information, business, archives.
  2. 自动化 (zìdònghuà)
    • pinyin: zìdònghuà
    • definition: automation
    • usage: the use of largely automatic equipment in a system of manufacturing or other production process.
    • example: 自动化提高了生产效率。(zìdònghuà tígāo le shēngchǎn xiàolǜ.) - automation has improved production efficiency.
    • contexts: industry, manufacturing, technology, robotics.
  3. 电子商务 (diànzǐ shāngwù)
    • pinyin: diànzǐ shāngwù
    • definition: e-commerce; electronic commerce
    • usage: commercial transactions conducted electronically on the internet.
    • example: 电子商务在全球范围内迅速发展。(diànzǐ shāngwù zài quánqiú fànwéi nèi xùnsù fāzhǎn.) - e-commerce is developing rapidly worldwide.
    • contexts: business, internet, online shopping, retail.
  4. 网上银行 (wǎngshàng yínháng)
    • pinyin: wǎngshàng yínháng
    • definition: online banking; internet banking
    • usage: a method of banking in which transactions are conducted electronically via the internet.
    • example: 我通常使用网上银行管理我的账户。(wǒ tōngcháng shǐyòng wǎngshàng yínháng guǎnlǐ wǒ de zhànghù.) - i usually use online banking to manage my accounts.
    • contexts: finance, banking, internet, convenience.
  5. 移动支付 (yídòng zhīfù)
    • pinyin: yídòng zhīfù
    • definition: mobile payment
    • usage: payment services operated under financial regulation and performed from or via a mobile device.
    • example: 移动支付在中国非常普及。(yídòng zhīfù zài zhōngguó fēicháng pǔjí.) - mobile payment is very popular in china.
    • contexts: finance, technology, smartphones, e-commerce.
  6. 共享经济 (gòngxiǎng jīngjì)
    • pinyin: gòngxiǎng jīngjì
    • definition: sharing economy
    • usage: an economic system in which assets or services are shared between private individuals, either free or for a fee, typically by means of the internet.
    • example: 共享单车是共享经济的一种体现。(gòngxiǎng dānchē shì gòngxiǎng jīngjì de yī zhǒng tǐxiàn.) - bike-sharing is a manifestation of the sharing economy.
    • contexts: economics, technology, internet, modern business models.
  7. 远程办公 (yuǎnchéng bàngōng)
    • pinyin: yuǎnchéng bàngōng
    • definition: remote work; telecommuting
    • usage: working from a location other than a central office, typically from home, using internet and telecommunications.
    • example: 疫情期间，很多公司都实行了远程办公。(yìqíng qījiān, hěnduō gōngsī dōu shíxíng le yuǎnchéng bàngōng.) - during the pandemic, many companies implemented remote work.
    • contexts: work, technology, lifestyle, business operations.
  8. 在线教育 (zàixiàn jiàoyù)
    • pinyin: zàixiàn jiàoyù
    • definition: online education; e-learning
    • usage: education that takes place over the internet.
    • example: 在线教育为学习者提供了更多灵活性。(zàixiàn jiàoyù wèi xuéxízhě tígōng le gèng duō línghuóxìng.) - online education offers learners more flexibility.
    • contexts: education, internet, technology, learning.
  9. 黑客 (hēikè)
    • pinyin: hēikè
    • definition: hacker
    • usage: a person who uses computers to gain unauthorized access to data.
    • example: 黑客攻击可能导致数据泄露。(hēikè gōngjī kěnéng dǎozhì shùjù xièlòu.) - hacker attacks can lead to data breaches.
    • contexts: cybersecurity, internet, crime, technology.
  10. 网络安全 (wǎngluò ānquán)
    • pinyin: wǎngluò ānquán
    • definition: cybersecurity; network security
    • usage: the state of being protected against the criminal or unauthorized use of electronic data, or the measures taken to achieve this.
    • example: 企业应高度重视网络安全问题。(qǐyè yīng gāodù zhòngshì wǎngluò ānquán wèntí.) - enterprises should attach great importance to cybersecurity issues.
    • contexts: technology, internet, data protection, IT.

day 70

  1. 创新 (chuàngxīn)
    • pinyin: chuàngxīn
    • definition: innovation; to innovate; to bring forth new ideas
    • usage: the action or process of innovating; a new method, idea, product, etc.
    • example: 科技创新是推动社会发展的动力。(kējì chuàngxīn shì tuīdòng shèhuì fāzhǎn de dònglì.) - technological innovation is the driving force for social development.
    • contexts: technology, business, research, development, creativity.
  2. 创业 (chuàngyè)
    • pinyin: chuàngyè
    • definition: to start a business; entrepreneurship
    • usage: the activity of setting up a business or businesses, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit.
    • example: 越来越多的年轻人选择创业。(yuèláiyuè duō de niánqīngrén xuǎnzé chuàngyè.) - more and more young people are choosing to start their own businesses.
    • contexts: business, economics, career, innovation.
  3. 初创公司 (chūchuàng gōngsī)
    • pinyin: chūchuàng gōngsī
    • definition: startup company
    • usage: a newly established business.
    • example: 这家初创公司在人工智能领域很有潜力。(zhè jiā chūchuàng gōngsī zài réngōng zhìnéng lǐngyù hěn yǒu qiánlì.) - this startup company has great potential in the field of artificial intelligence.
    • contexts: business, entrepreneurship, technology, investment.
  4. 技术支持 (jìshù zhīchí)
    • pinyin: jìshù zhīchí
    • definition: technical support
    • usage: a service provided by a hardware or software company which provides registered users with help and advice about their products.
    • example: 如果遇到问题，可以联系我们的技术支持团队。(rúguǒ yùdào wèntí, kěyǐ liánxì wǒmen de jìshù zhīchí tuánduì.) - if you encounter any problems, you can contact our technical support team.
    • contexts: customer service, IT, software, hardware.
  5. 故障 (gùzhàng)
    • pinyin: gùzhàng
    • definition: malfunction; breakdown; fault; glitch
    • usage: a failure to function in a normal or satisfactory way.
    • example: 由于设备故障，系统暂时无法使用。(yóuyú shèbèi gùzhàng, xìtǒng zànshí wúfǎ shǐyòng.) - due to equipment malfunction, the system is temporarily unavailable.
    • contexts: technology, machinery, electronics, problem solving.
  6. 修复 (xiūfù)
    • pinyin: xiūfù
    • definition: to repair; to restore; to fix
    • usage: to restore (something damaged, faulty, or worn) to a good condition.
    • example: 工程师正在努力修复系统故障。(gōngchéngshī zhèngzài nǔlì xiūfù xìtǒng gùzhàng.) - engineers are working hard to repair the system failure.
    • contexts: technology, maintenance, problem solving, construction.
  7. 兼容性 (jiānróngxìng)
    • pinyin: jiānróngxìng
    • definition: compatibility (of software, hardware, etc.)
    • usage: (of two things) able to exist or occur together without conflict; (of software) able to run on a particular computer or with a particular system.
    • example: 购买新硬件时要注意其兼容性。(gòumǎi xīn yìngjiàn shí yào zhùyì qí jiānróngxìng.) - pay attention to compatibility when purchasing new hardware.
    • contexts: technology, software, hardware, product specifications.
  8. 升级 (shēngjí)
    • pinyin: shēngjí
    • definition: to upgrade; to update (software, system, etc.)
    • usage: to raise (something) to a higher standard, in particular improve (equipment or machinery) by adding or replacing components.
    • example: 我需要升级我的电脑操作系统。(wǒ xūyào shēngjí wǒ de diànnǎo cāozuò xìtǒng.) - i need to upgrade my computer’s operating system.
    • contexts: technology, software, hardware, improvement.
  9. 备份 (bèifèn)
    • pinyin: bèifèn
    • definition: to back up (data); backup (noun)
    • usage: a copy of a file or other item of data made in case the original is lost or damaged.
    • example: 定期备份重要数据非常重要。(dìngqī bèifèn zhòngyào shùjù fēicháng zhòngyào.) - it is very important to back up important data regularly.
    • contexts: data security, computers, IT, disaster recovery.
  10. 数字鸿沟 (shùzì hónggōu)
    • pinyin: shùzì hónggōu
    • definition: digital divide
    • usage: the gulf between those who have ready access to computers and the internet, and those who do not.
    • example: 努力缩小数字鸿沟是社会发展的重要议题。(nǔlì suōxiǎo shùzì hónggōu shì shèhuì fāzhǎn de zhòngyào yìtí.) - striving to narrow the digital divide is an important issue for social development.
    • contexts: sociology, technology, education, inequality, public policy.
